p: HMPV positive samples identified between 2007 and 2011 ( n = 160) were partially sequenced in the F and G genes, 345 and 606 bp, respectively [ 28]. For HMPV positive samples identified between 2012 and 2016 ( n = 114), we amplified full F and G encoding genes, approximately 1620 bp and 700 bp, respectively, using one-step RT-PCR kit (Qiagen, Germany) according to manufacturer’s instructions. RT-PCR and sequencing primers are shown in Additional file 1. Thermocycling conditions for both genes were set at: 50 °C for 30 min, 95 °C for 15 min, 38 cycles of 94 °C for 1 min, 53 °C for 1 min, 72 °C for 1 min, and a final extension of 10 min at 72 °C. HMPV A and B subtype specific primers were used to increase the sensitivity and the performance of G gene amplification. HMPV positive samples were sequenced in both forward and reverse directions using Big dye terminator v1.3 chemistry run on ABI 3130xl instrument [ 33].
